Class SimpleCar

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleCar

  • public class SimpleCar
extends java.lang.Object
    Description: simulates the functionality of a basic car. You can do simple things like drive, add gas and honk the horn.
    Version:
    2/02/2
    Author:
    Christian Tsoungui Nkoulou

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.text.DecimalFormat fmt 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleCar()
      This default constructor sets the miles per gallon to 22.7, the car model to "Generic Car", fills the tank, sets the odometer to zero and sets mileage for the next oil change
      SimpleCar(java.lang.String model, double mpg)
      This constructor does everything the default constructor does but also sets the car model and miles per gallon provided by the parameters: model and mpg.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGas(double g)
      adds oil to amount of gas and prints new amount in the tank
      void changeOil()
      changes oil and tell user when to change oil next
      double checkGasGauge()
      returns the amount of gas
      double checkNextOilChange()
      returns the mileage
      int checkOdometer()
      returns the number of miles
      void checkOil()
      Tells user whether to change oil or not
      void drive(int miles)
      simulates car driving and adds miles driven to odometer
      void honkHorn()
      simulates honkHorn
